data:
Stable Patient 
- febrile and no signs of septic shock (alert, normal BO, normal perfusion)
- Febrile - oral temperature greater than 38.5 DegC (or greater than 38 DegC for 2 readings 1 hour apart)
- Neutropenic - ANC less than 1
B.C Children's Hospital Fever and Neutropenia Guidelines
heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, temperature q30min
If patient has Central Venous Catheter, access all lumens / ports and draw bloodwork
If no Central Venous Catheter present, start peripheral IV and obtain blood work

sodium chloride 0.9% IV bolus:  
1) Repeat in 20 mL/kg increments up to 60 mL/kg   
2) If no response after bolus #2 of Sodium Chloride 0.9%, consider initiation of inotropes  
3) If patient develops signs of fluid overload, hold crystalloids and start inotropes  
4) Consider using warmed fluids and/or rapid infuser if clinically indicated
5) If 60 mL/kg of crystalloid fluid is given, then mandatory critical care consult
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 5 minute, drug form:bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 15 minute, drug form:bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute, drug form:bag
PED Peripheral IV and IV Fluids (Module)
Commence antimicrobials as per Fever and Neutropenia Guidelines immediately after blood work drawn
Consider dosage adjustments for renal impairment
75 mg/kg, IV, q6h, drug form: inj
For severe penicillin or cephalosporin allergy (e.g. anaphylaxis)
50 mg/kg, IV, q8h, drug form: inj
10 mg/kg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
10 mg/kg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
If unable to tolerate oral antimicrobials
75 mg/kg, IV, q6h, drug form: inj
